page.title: 02The Ecology of SW Fairford
page.content: Through the gravelly soils of Fairford flows the River Coln, fast and clean. In the{hedgerows}grow hawthorn,elder, blackthorn,brambles,dogrose and honeysuckle, and{trees}such as ash,sycamore,willow,beech,hedge maple,horse chestnut and poplar.There are some oak and larch. { Flowers}growing include snowdrops,cowslips,bluebells,poppies, buttercups,kingcups,fritillaries and rare orchids. In the{river}live trout,on it swim swans,moorhens,coot,grebe and mallard. Weed,rushes and iris grow in the river.In the{fields}live rabbits,hares and pheasants. As well as the common {birds}are wagtails,magpies,jackdaws, herons,kingfishers,and dippers.Many migratory geese come to the gravel pits in the autumn.
